definition: paper/CL:張|张[zhang1],沓[da2]/classifier for documents, letter etc
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: This paper can serve as the reference for the mills to select the board machine.
sentences.chinese: 本文試述紙板成形器的選用與發展趨勢，供同行參考。

sentences.english: We would suggest that you strengthen the cartons with double straps.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我方建議用兩根包裝帶加固紙板箱。

sentences.english: Reuse and recycle. Re-purpose plastic containers and cardboard boxes where you can.
sentences.chinese: 在你能夠的地方重複使用塑料容器和硬紙板盒子。

sentences.english: Cardboard boxes for the tenements, doors and windows painstankingly detailed with coloured pens.
sentences.chinese: 用水彩筆描繪的紙板箱是用來裝公寓，大門和窗戶的。

sentences.english: The eggs are packed in cartons with beehives lined with shake-proof paper board.
sentences.chinese: 雞蛋要用帶蜂房孔，外襯防震紙板的紙箱包裝。

sentences.english: Cardboard, Thick round Reel centers, broke down.
sentences.chinese: 紙板，厚圓捲筒中心，打破了。

sentences.english: Yes, I have managed to get the source-application for the pasteboard data.
sentences.chinese: 是的，我已經拿到紙板的源程序數據。

sentences.english: In China, coffins made of cardboards were available.
sentences.chinese: 在中國可以買到硬紙板製成的棺木。

sentences.english: She made a small casket with paper board.
sentences.chinese: 她用紙板做了一個匣子。

sentences.english: Place the second pad on top of partition.
sentences.chinese: 將另一塊紙板放在紙卡的上面。

sentences.english: His mother used cardboard to section off a small pantry.
sentences.chinese: 他母親用硬紙板隔了一小間食品室。

sentences.english: Pre-creasing wheel to prevents crushing board.
sentences.chinese: 預壓傳送，防止紙板壓破現象。

sentences.english: Then you can quickly retrieve items from your pasteboard to reuse.
sentences.chinese: 然後，你就可以迅速檢索項目從您的紙板重用。

sentences.english: The cardboard backing was just a strengthener.
sentences.chinese: 這個紙板襯背就是一個助力器。

sentences.english: She clipped all the important documents onto the paperboard.
sentences.chinese: 她把所有重要文件都用針別在這個紙板上。

sentences.english: But my fancy accordion might as well have been a cardboard box that afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 但是那天下午，我別緻的手風琴好像變成了紙板盒。

definition: to glue to/to paste onto/to stick on/also written 粘貼|粘贴[zhan1 tie1]
paper money/a bill (e.g. 100 yuan)/CL:張|张[zhang1],紮|扎[za1]
to pile up/to put layer upon layer/(Tw) (computing) stack
deformation/to become deformed/to change shape/to morph
